description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9i317","text":"INTRODUCTION:","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72ldg","text":"This protocol outlines the steps which ViroTrakr contributors need to follow in order to submit their data to NCBI. It includes how to: ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c39ev","text":"- establish your new BioProject at NCBI;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90lgq","text":"- link it to ViroTrakr;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mi48","text":"- create BioSample numbers for your submission and submit raw sequence data to the SRA database;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqcgu","text":"- submit assembled data to GenBank and link them to ViroTrakr (optional).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"608gl","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsj52","text":"ViroTrakr, a genomic database initiated by CFSAN and housed in NCBI, aims to (1) cover sequences of a wide range of foodborne viruses (e.g., norovirus, hepatitis A virus, sapovirus, etc.) from clinical, food and/or environmental specimens and (2) provide real-time reference sequences for phylogenetic analysis and epidemiologic studies linked to foodborne illnesses. Pipelines are under development with which ViroTrakr will eventually integrate to an international genomic reference database, GenomeTrakr, which has been successfully employed for bacterial pathogen surveillance in multiple countries. You simply need to login a different way: through a third party option.
